etymology.description: 行(行) (xíng, "to go; to walk") refers to the act of moving or proceeding. 動(動) (dòng, "move; act") refers to motion or action. Together, 行動(行動) (xíngdòng, "action; movement") describes the process of taking action or engaging in movement.
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 行(行) (xíng, "to go; to walk") and 動(動) (dòng, "move; act") underscores the dynamic nature of engaging in purposeful action or movement. This reflects a proactive and intentional behavior.

examples.chinese: 为了成功(為了成功)，他们展开行動(他們展開行動)。
examples.pinyin: Wèi le chénggōng, tāmen zhǎnkāi xíngdòng.
examples.english: They took action to achieve success.

examples.chinese: 改革需要行動(改革需要行動)。
当局决定採取行動(當局決定採取行動)，以确保安全(以確保安全)。
examples.pinyin: Dāngjú juédìng cǎiqǔ xíngdòng, yǐ quèbǎo ānquán.
examples.english: The authorities decided to take action to ensure security.
